events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th involving a car and a tree. The vehicle sustained major front-end damage.
Claim was categorised under the Auto Accident cluster after reviewing the initial details and reported keywords in the claim submission.
An insurance agent has been assigned to the case to handle communications and coordinate the claim process with the customer.
The insurance company officially acknowledged the receipt of the claim and assured the customer that processing would begin promptly.
Request sent to customer asking for photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to support the claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed repair quotes, accident photos, and a copy of the police report.
Investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence and contacted third parties for additional verification regarding the vehicle accident.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of the accident details and damage assessment consistent with the customer’s submitted documents.
Insurance company proposed a settlement offer covering the repair costs minus the deductible based on the damage assessment report.
The customer responded to the settlement offer expressing concerns about the coverage amount and requested further review.
Due to customer concerns, the claim was escalated to senior management for reconsideration of the settlement value.
After escalation review, the claim was approved with an increased settlement amount meeting the customer’s expectations.
Insurance payment was issued promptly to the customer’s account to cover the approved vehicle repair costs following claim approval.
The claim has been officially closed after confirming that the vehicle repairs were completed and customer was satisfied with the resolution.
